thread.title: Bill allowing online voter registration up for hearing
thread.title_full: Bill allowing online voter registration up for hearing

title: Bill allowing online voter registration up for hearing
text:
Bill allowing online voter registration up for hearing Bill allowing Wisconsin voters to register online up for hearing in Legislature Published On: Oct 13 2015 08:34:34 AM CDT SXC MADISON, Wis. - 
Wisconsin residents with driver's licenses or state identification cards could register to vote online under a bill up for a public hearing in the Legislature. Related Content House hardliner: We would consider Ryan for House speaker 
The Republican-backed measure was scheduled for a joint Senate and Assembly hearing on Tuesday. 
Democrats who had been co-sponsors of the measure dropped their support on Monday, and the Wisconsin League of Women Voters voiced opposition because the proposal would get rid of special registration deputies. 
Those deputies are used to canvas neighborhoods and get people registered to vote. 
In addition to allowing online registration, the bill would also permit people who are already registered to change their name and address online and shorten the window when absentee ballots could be received and be counted. 
The bill is on a fast track in the Legislature. 
Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.
